question: Do you offer Creative Cloud licenses for faculty and staff?

question: Do you offer Adobe Acrobat Pro DC licenses for students?
answer: No, these licenses are only available for active employees.  Students with a Creative Cloud license can utilize the Adobe Acrobat Pro DC app within Creative Cloud.

question: Can I install the software on more than one computer?
answer: You are eligible for two instances of the product to be installed under your name. This allows you to sign into Creative Cloud from two different university owned devices (desktop and laptop) at the same time.

question: Where can I get assistance with installing the software in a lab or classroom?
answer: To request installation of the software in a lab or classroom, contact theService Desk.

question: I am getting an error message when I attempt to login.  What should I do?
answer: Please ensure you’ve accepted the Adobe terms and conditions. If you are still experiencing an issue, please open a ticket with theService Deskand provide your netname and the exact error message you receive.

question: Does the Adobe site license provide work-at-home licenses for a small fee to eligible faculty and staff?
answer: No. Creative Cloud software covered under the Adobe site license can be installed on university and personally owned computers.

question: Who do I contact for a quote for Adobe software not covered under the agreement?
answer: Adobe Software that is not covered by our agreement with Adobe can be purchased through our software reseller. To obtain a quote, open a ticket with theIT Service Desk. Acrobat Pro DC and Creative Cloud software arenotavailable for purchase because they are available, at no extra cost, under our agreement with Adobe.

question: I would like to upgrade our departments meeting room, however, I don't have a budget. What are my options?
answer: IITS has an audiovisual evergreen program that covers upgrading departmental meeting rooms over a lifecycle of 7 years. You can reach out to our TLCSS team to inquiry about when your room is scheduled to be upgraded.

question: If my request is to install open source software, does this guarantee the software can be installed?
answer: No – All software needs to be tested on the computer configurations beforehand to assess the feasibility of the request.

question: How quickly can my request be processed and the software installed?
answer: Each request is different and needs to be assessed individually. Sufficient lead time is required to ensure analysis, testing and installation can be fulfilled before the event.

question: My software is not free and I do not have licenses. Can I still make a request?
answer: Each request is different and needs to be assessed individually. The person analyzing this request will look at licensing and costs associated.

question: Can freeware be installed on a classroom or lab computer?
answer: Applications or software that are listed as freeware or trial-ware are prohibited on classroom or lab workstations. This is due to licensing restrictions and lack of technical support from vendors. If you require a specific software package installed for teaching purposes, submit a request to the Service Desk using thewebform.

question: What software is already installed in the labs?
answer: Each lab has its own set of software, depending on the needs of its department and users. For lab availability and a list of installed software, visit the lab's information page:

question: My classroom is not in the CC, H, or MB building. Which Service Centre should I contact?
answer: Please contact the closest geographically located Service Centre. For example, all classrooms at the Loyola Campus are supported by the Loyola Service Centre.

question: What happens if the classroom problem cannot be resolved?
answer: Technicians always do their best to resolve problems immediately and have access to spare equipment in the case of failure. If the problem cannot be resolved, these incidents will be escalated to a higher level support team which will ensure resolution and follow-up with our clients.

question: Can I bring my own laptop to connect to a classroom projector?
answer: Yes, faculty can plug in their own laptops in all registrar rooms. Currently, HDMI is the standard connection type, although there are some rooms that now support USB-C. If you have an Apple device such as a Macbook or iPad, you will need to supply your own adapter. If you’re unsure of what kind of adapter you need or how to connect your device to the projector, contact the closest Service Centre. Learn more about thetypes of classroomsthat are available to you.

answer: The 'open use' labs cannot be reserved. For a list of labs that can be reserved, take a look through the labs available forteaching use.

question: Can I access a Library workstation if I’m not a member of the Concordia community?

question: Can I install software on a lab computer?
answer: Yes – additional software installations can be requested in computer labs. More information regarding services offered and costs associated is available on theclassroom and lab software installation page.

question: What is the standard software package installed on PC lab and classroom computers?
answer: While other software may be present, there is astandard software package installed on PC workstations inclassrooms, open-use labs, andteaching labs.

question: What happens to decommissioned equipment?
answer: Equipment is evaluated and redistributed for internal reuse, university testing and development purposes, donation, or external recycling, in that respective order.

question: How do I save data off my computer before decommissioning?
answer: Before a computer is decommissioned, it is the user’s responsibility to identify any data that needs to be retrieved and to take the appropriate measures to safeguard it. If you require assistance with your data management, contact theService Deskfor assistance.

question: Where is equipment donated?
answer: If your equipment is not suitable for internal reuse and still usable, it will be donated.

question: Will the data on my hard-drive be erased?
answer: IITS or theIT contact for your departmentwill erase the hard disk to ensure that no information can be recovered, using a secure standardized sanitizing method.

question: Can equipment that is at the end of its lifecycle be reused within the University?
answer: Concordia Assets that have reached the end of their operational life may be redistributed for University testing and development purposes. Since these devices are at the end of their lifecycle, technical support for these devices is no longer provided.

question: Can University assets be donated to external organizations for reuse?
answer: Concordia assets are decommissioned and donated to a non-profit organization.

question: How can I get help if I don't know which computer to buy?
answer: Contact theService Deskor your department designatedIT technician or support team. These knowledgeable technicians will be able to provide counsel on equipment, software and migration.

question: Why has Concordia chosen to select standard computers?
answer: There are several reasons. Costs will be significantly reduced by making bulk purchases of fewer models from one contracted manufacturer. Having fewer models creates a consistency among systems deployed throughout the university, improving compatibility and technical hardware and software support. This also means an easier deployment and updating of software by having pre-installed site-licensed software on each computer.

question: Why does the computer have to be asset tagged?
answer: Because it makes it clear that the computer belongs to Concordia – no need to provide proof of purchase or receipt.

question: How are non-standard computers supported?
answer: Non-standard computers are supported on a best effort basis either by Instructional and Information Technology Services (IITS) or your designated departmentalIT technician or support team.

question: Do I own the computer I am purchasing with university funds?
answer: All computers are the property of Concordia University regardless of the source of funds or whether purchased from the standard list or not. Therefore, the computer must be properly inventoried and asset tagged according to the policy and protected by installing university anti-virus software.

question: Who can I contact to help set up my new computer?
answer: Consult theComputer Supportsection, contact your departmentIT-representative, or contact theService Desk.

question: Where can I obtain anti-virus software to install on my computer?
answer: SentinelOne is available for Concordia-owned devices.Learn how to get SentinelOne.

question: If I have an issue with my new computer, how do I get support?
answer: Contact theService Deskor you department'sIT representative.

question: What is the difference between the Apple Store for Education and the Apple Store for Education Institution?  Can I purchase a computer with Concordia University funds from the Apple Store for Education?
answer: The Apple Store for Education is not the same as the Apple Store for Education Institution. Any purchase made on the Apple Store for Education is considered a personal purchase and is not considered to be the property of Concordia University.

question: What is the return policy for purchasing Apple products? What if I change my mind on the Apple product I just purchased?
answer: For the educational sector, Apple only accepts the return of unopened products resulting from an Apple shipping or order processing error.  All other sales are final.  The only return exception is if there is a problem with the Apple computer (hardware) upon arrival.  For more information, reviewApple's educational sector return policy.

question: Is my home computer supported?
answer: No. Support is provided to Concordia owned devices only.

question: Should I contact the Service Desk if my department offers IT support?
answer: IITS offers personal computer support to all departments without local IT support teams. If your department has a designatedIT technician or support team, please contact them directly.

question: What does Concordia manage on my computer?
answer: Computers that are managed by Concordia IT departments have presets and settings that defines how a system will look and how it will behave. To ensure security, some settings are restrictive and cannot be changed by the user. These settings are configured specifically for the Concordia community and are imposed to protect the computers and provide a better overall experience.

question: How does Concordia manage my computer?
answer: Concordia IT departments use a series of system and tools to manage computers and other Concordia devices. The main tools are Microsoft Endpoint Manager, Jamf, Active Directory Group Policies, and scripts.

question: I can no longer use my static IP address to remotely connect to my workstation. How can I connect?
answer: You can remotely connect to your workstation by using your workstation’s hostname. This information can be retrieved from your workstation by opening a web browser and typing in the URL field “myip.concordia.ca” (without the quotes). Your hostname is in the “Host and Domain Name” section.

question: How can I use the VPN and Remote Desktop to connect to my office computer from home?
answer: To connect to your office computer from home, you first need to connect to the Concordia network by establishing a VPN connection. Once the VPN connection is established, you can use Remote Desktop to connect to your office computer.

question: I am unable to log into the Concordia Carrefour. What should I do?
answer: Ensure that you are:

question: My personal information is not accepted when I try to reset my password. What should I do?
answer: Faculty and staff should contact the Service Desk by phone at 514-848-2424, ext. 7613, or by email athelp@concordia.ca.

question: Can I change my netname?
answer: Netnames are computer-generated based on your legal name upon acceptance to Concordia as a staff, faculty or student, or upon submission of an application for admission. Netnames can only be changed in the event of a legal name change.

question: How can I change my e-mail address in the Concordia Carrefour?
answer: To ensure you receive important information from Concordia, please enter your e-mail address in the Concordia Carrefour. Correspondences from professors (including through Moodle), administrators and other Concordia departments will be sent to this e-mail address.

question: How do I access the services that are currently on MyConcordia?
answer: All the services that are currently on the MyConcordia portal are available to you on the Concordia Carrefour via the “My CU Account” page. This page is easily accessed from the landing page, navigation bar and through the sign-in menu drop-down found at the top right-hand side of every concordia.ca page.

question: After the Concordia Carrefour launch, will all older legacy systems that currently require authentication become single sign-on?
answer: Some older legacy systems still require additional authentication because they are not compatible with single-sign-on. As new solutions replace these legacy systems, single sign-on will become the norm for everything available via the Concordia Carrefour.

question: Is the MyConcordia portal still  available to employees? Do I have to switch over to the new Concordia Carrefour right away?
answer: The project team is encouraging faculty and staff to explore the Concordia Carrefour and access its many features. The MyConcordia portal is still accessible to give employees time to adapt and become familiar with the new system.

question: After the launch, will all the information on the Concordia Carrefour  match what is on the MyConcordia portal?
answer: All the information on the Concordia Carrefour matches what is on MyConcordia. Both portals will provide access to the same systems and, as such, the same information.

question: Where can I find Cspace content?
answer: All Cspace content has been consolidated and is now available through the new “Services and Resources” page. To avoid broken links during the transition period, there are temporary redirects from every Cspace page to their new location in the Concordia Carrefour.

question: Can I access Moodle from the Concordia Carrefour ?
answer: Moodle is accessible through the Concordia Carrefour and no longer requires employees to have to sign in again. Anew pageview will offer faculty and staff a list of all of their current courses.

question: Do I have to do anything differently to access any systems if I am working remotely?
answer: No. There are several subsystems that require employees to connect to Concordia’s Virtual Private Network (VPN) to access them, but the Concordia Carrefour will clearly identify those applications

question: If I have issues connecting to the Concordia Carrefour, whom should I contact for help?
answer: New and existing employees can contact theService Deskfor any issues connecting to the Concordia Carrefour.

question: Do student employees have to log in to both the Student Hub and the Concordia Carrefour ?
answer: Yes. At this time, student employees will have to manage dual identities through the Student Hub and the Concordia Carrefour by signing in with their student credentials or staff credentials, respectively.

question: Are role accounts that provide access to certain applications available for the Concordia Carrefour ?
answer: The same access mechanisms that were used in the MyConcordia portal will apply to the Concordia Carrefour.

question: If I have multiple working roles at Concordia (i.e. a faculty member who is also an administrator), what will I see when I access the Concordia Carrefour ?
answer: Following the first release of the Concordia Carrefour, all employees have access to the same news and events feeds. In subsequent releases, the Concordia Carrefour will be able to identify employees with multiple working roles and present content that is specific to their positions at the university.

question: I am retired. Do I have access to the Concordia Carrefour?
answer: As long as a retired employee maintains their netname, they will be able to access the Concordia Carrefour.

question: I have questions about campus tours. Who can I contact?
answer: Call us at 514-848-2424, ext. 4779, or email us atTours

question: I have questions about booking an appointment with someone. Who can I contact?
I am unable to log into the CRM. What should I do?
answer: Please contact the IT Service Desk at extension 7613 or byemail

question: I’m interested in studying at Concordia but I have questions before I book my appointment. Who can I contact?
answer: Consult ourquestions page

question: I need help preparing a curriculum dossier. Who can I contact?
answer: Please emailcurriculum@concordia.cato schedule a session for support in preparing your curriculum change dossier or for more information about the approval process.

question: I have questions or concerns about accessing the live training for the CCMS. Who can I contact?
answer: Please emailccms@concordia.caif you have any questions about the learning materials after you have been granted access to the Moodle site.

question: I need to report a technical issue logging in, or accessing the CCMS. Who can I contact?
answer: Please email theService Deskto report technical bugs related to the CCMS

question: I am unable to sign into the Concordia app. What should I do?
answer: Ensure that:

question: Where can I find my class schedule, my grades and my account balance?
answer: These features are located under My account. You will be asked to sign in prior to seeing your personal content.

question: What if the Concordia app contains a mistake in my class schedule, grades, or account balance?
answer: First, you can try to click the "Refresh" button located at the bottom of each of these sections. If the data is still incorrect, please contact theService Desk.

question: I am encountering a problem with the app, such as a "No Internet Connection" message.
answer: Please make sure you are using the latest version of the app, (3.0 or higher). If you continue to encounter problems with the latest version of the app, please contact theService Desk.

question: Who can I contact if I have comments or suggestions?
answer: For any comments and suggestions related to Concordia’s mobile app, please contactmobile.support@concordia.ca.

question: What username and password do I use to access the wireless network?
answer: Please use your Concordia E-mail address and the password to login the wireless network.

question: What platforms are officially supported by Concordia?
answer: Officially, Concordia supports: Mac OS X, iPhone, iPad, iPod touch, Blackberry, and Android.

question: Why won't my computer accept new credentials for wireless access?
answer: When you successfully log on to a wireless or wired network that uses Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (PEAP) authentication, your credentials are automatically stored in the computer for reuse. This may sometimes interfere with your computer's ability to accept new credentials.

question: Why should I trust the Public certificate “wireless.concordia.ca”?
answer: The wireless.concordia,ca certificate is used to prove that the authentication server you are authenticating to is in fact the correct server. It will protect your devices from the some security attacks (e.g. man in middle attack) which can steal your personal information (e.g. credential).

question: How do I request a wireless access code?
answer: To request a guest wireless access code, please fill theweb format least 5 business days prior to your date of usage.

question: I forgot my access code. How can I retrieve it?
answer: To retrieve your lost access code, contact theService Desk.

question: How long is my access code valid?
answer: Access codes are valid for a maximum of 1 week, but may be deactivated sooner depending on their intended purpose.

question: Is there a cost associated for requesting access codes?
answer: Charges may apply when requesting access code for over 10 participants.

question: Is it mandatory to use CONDOR to save my documents?
answer: No. Concordia offers several services to save your documents: CONDOR and departmental drive. As they serve different needs, you decide which service you prefer to use. Should you need help to sort and reorganize your departmental drive, please contact RMA atrecords.management@concordia.ca.

question: What is the difference between Teams and CONDOR?
answer: Teams is a collaboration tool and should be used to collaborate and have discussions. CONDOR should be used to save, store, share, and keep documents

question: What are the advantages of using CONDOR?
answer: CONDOR is a SharePoint service, therefore you can access your content stored in CONDOR from any device (computer, phone, tablet) at any time, if you have an internet connexion.

question: What are the disadvantages of using CONDOR?
answer: CONDOR has limited collaboration capabilities.

question: I already saved documents in Teams; do I also have to use CONDOR?
answer: Teams should be primarily seen as a collaboration tool. It is recommended to use CONDOR to save final version and documents to share.

question: I am already saving my documents on Google Drive, Drop Box or Box; do I have to use CONDOR?
answer: It is not recommended to save institutional documents on a third-party platform not supported by IITS such as Google Drive, Drop Box or Box. These solutions are easy targets for thieves and malicious individuals. RMA strongly recommends saving your documents in CONDOR to properly protect your information.

question: I am already saving my documents on a departmental drive; do I have to switch to CONDOR?
answer: As CONDOR and departmental drive serve different needs, you can decide which service you would prefer to use. Should you need help to sort and reorganize your departmental drive, please contact RMA atrecords.management@concordia.ca.

question: I accidentally deleted a document; can I get it back?
answer: Yes, deleted documents are accessible in the recycle bin for 90 days following the deletion.

question: How do I save a document in CONDOR?
answer: Documents are automatically saved as you are updating the file.

question: How do I share a document in CONDOR?
answer: See instructions onShare SharePoint files or folderson Microsoft's support website.

question: Are there any limitations on my usage of CONDOR?
answer: Your usage must be in accordance with the Policy on IT Security.

question: How do I know if I need a Cookie Management tool on my website?
answer: If you are unsure whether your site needs cookie management or is in compliance with theAct, you can contact theService Deskand our team will perform a scan of your website.

question: What should I do if I upgrade or take down my website?
answer: Please contact theService Deskfor assistance.

question: What are cookies?
answer: A cookie is a very small text document stored on your computer or other device (and maintained by your browser) when you visit a website. It often includes a randomized unique identifier so that a website can “recognize” this cookie again on your next visit. Cookies allow the functioning of websites, improve browsing, or provide certain information to website owners, particularly in terms of audience measurement.

question: Is my data safe?
answer: Your data is stored on a redundant file system and backed up during the day. Data is copied to another location nightly in case of failure of the primary storage system.

question: How can I request permission changes?
answer: The folder administrators within your department handle permission changes by contacing theService Desk.

question: What is a departmental administrator?
answer: A departmental administrator is someone within your department with authority to make decisions pertaining to access and account management.

question: How do I create a new shared folder within my departmental drive?
answer: If you are the designated departmental administrator, contact theService Deskto request that a shared folder be created or modified within your departmental drive.

question: How do I know who has access to my shared files?
answer: The folder administrators will receive a report every semester that lists users with read or read-write access to their shared folder.

question: Are their guidelines for naming my new shared folder?
answer: Folder names should have a maximum of 25 characters and include only letters from a-z and hyphens. No other special characters will be accepted.

question: Can I change the name of an existing shared folder?
answer: To change the name of an existing shared folder, the folder's content will need to be migrated to a new folder with the updated name. The previous folder can then be deleted. Requests like this can be processed by contacting theService Desk.

question: How do I map a departmental drive on my computer?
answer: Windows

question: How can I request permission changes?
answer: To request file storage or access to existing group file sharing space, the file share owner must contact theService Desk. Should you require access to a shared file already in existence, the Service Desk will need the complete path of the folder at the time of the request.

question: What is my quota on the group file share?
answer: Groups are allocated 100GB of storage space.

question: How do I authenticate on the group file share?
answer: Files can be accessed from any computer on the Concordia domain using a valid netname and password.

question: How do I switch from the group file share to a departmental drive?
answer: Users on the group file sharing system will be contacted to arrange for migration to the departmental drives service.

question: I do not have a Concordia email address, can I use my personal email?
answer: No, active faculty, staff, and students must activate their Concordia email to use the service, see the following links with instructions forfaculty & staff, or forstudents.

question: I activated my email but I still do not have access?
answer: Please note that email activation may take 48 hours to complete.

question: Do I need to connect to VPN to access the virtual machine?
answer: No, a VPN connection is not required.

question: I have access but I can’t find the application I need
answer: Please contact theService Desk, we will get back to you to discuss your requirements and find a solution.

question: What does the Pilot project imply?
answer: The DaaS pilot project is being offered for a limited duration during the Fall 2020 semester. Following the end of the pilot, decisions will be made to modify, continue, or discontinue the service.

question: DocuSign Glossary

question: FAQ on electronic signature and the e-signature framework
answer: An e-signature or electronic signature is a signature made electronically that has the same legal value as a handwritten signature. It includes a documented process and audit trail which has the same legal value as a handwritten signature.

question: FAQ for electronic signature senders
answer: If you are having issues with DocuSign, please visitDocuSign Support.

question: FAQ for recipients
answer: See the DocuSign step-by-step guide:How to Sign a Document

question: Who can use the DPrint departmental devices?
answer: Faculty and staff who have been authorized under their departmental budget code and assigned a user ID.

question: How do I get a User ID?
answer: To obtain a User ID (print code), a request must be submitted to the Service Desk viaweb formby someone with signing authority in your department. The request should include the name of the requestor, the new person to be added, the department, and the departmental budget code.

question: Can I add a new Account ID (budget code) to my User ID?
answer: Yes, by submitting a request to the Service Desk viaweb formstating the budget code you wish to add. All budget codes will be verified before assigning to a corresponding Account ID.

answer: Only DPrint administrators designated in each department can obtain reports. DPrint administrators typically have budget signing authority, are the VOIP coordinator and/or are the department administrator.

question: I need to relocate my DPrint device, what do I do?
answer: To have a device relocated, submit aweb formto the Service Desk a minimum of5 business daysbefore the move will occur.

question: Who can use the DPrint self-serve printing, copying, and scanning services?

answer: A sign on the top of each device identifies them as colour or black and white. A full list of DPrint self-serve devices can be found in the documentation section of this page.

answer: It is likely that you are trying to retrieve your print job from a type of device that does not match the printing option that you selected (colour vs. black and white). Check both types of machines to locate the file you wish to print.

question: How do I copy from a book?
answer: The simplest way is to use the ‘book copying’ function.

question: Why do I get blank pages when I copy from the glass?
answer: It is likely that you have your original on the wrong corner of the glass. Always orient your original to the corner of the glass with thegreen arrow.

question: How do I copy odd sized originals, ID cards, or delicate paper?
answer: Place the original face down on the glass (corner with green arrow) and cover it with a sheet of blank paper. The devices will automatically detect the original size to be the same as the cover sheet.

question: When I scan documents to my email, which email address do they go to?
answer: The scan will be sent tothe email address associated with your Student Centre account.Note:Gmail is the preferred address due to others (Hotmail, MSN and Yahoo) blocking scans as SPAM.

question: What credentials should a Concordia student or employee use to access the Eduroam network?
answer: When visiting another institution, Concordia students, faculty and staff should use their Concordia netname and password to access the Eduroam network.

question: Does my device require configuration to connect to Eduroam?
answer: The setup requirements to access a particular institution’s eduroam service varies. Concordia University members need to consult the set-up instructions published at the institution they are visiting. Visitors to Concordia need to follow the configuration instructions outlined in the documentation section of ourWireless networkpage.

question: How can I ensure that my credentials will work when I visit an institution using Eduroam?

question: General FAQ (primary mailbox)
answer: Your username is your UPN which is the same as your primary email address, and your password is the same as the password associated with your netname. For more information, visit theNetname account managementpage.

question: Online archive mailbox FAQ
answer: The online archive mailbox is a specialized mailbox that works in conjunction with your primary mailbox, allowing messages to be quickly and easily archived to a location that is accessible from anywhere.

question: How can I sign up for an Office 365 email account?
answer: Activate your Office 365 email account.Your account will be accessible in 2 business days.

question: When can I activate my email account?
answer: You will be able to activate your email account two weeks prior to the beginning of the semester.

question: How can I configure MFA for my Microsoft 365 account?
answer: Please visit theMulti-factor authentication page for studentson how to configure MFA on your Android or iOS mobile device or Home phone for your Microsoft 365 account.

question: What programs are available in the Office 365 apps?
answer: All students have access to the same set of Office 365 apps which includes online versions of the office suite and a set of additional apps used for collaborating and file sharing.

question: What are the system requirements for Office 365?
answer: To install Office 365 Education, your device must meet theminimum system requirements.

question: I have an email address ending in @live.concordia.ca. Am I eligible for the @mail.concordia.ca alias?
answer: If you have already activated the @live.concordia.ca email account, you may choose to activate the new @mail.concordia.ca email alias.

question: I forgot my username and/or password. What do I do?
answer: On the main login page, you will need to enter 'your_netname@live.concordia.ca' to access the Concordia-specific login page.

question: What should I do if I'm unable to access my Office 365 email account?
answer: If it's been 2 business days since you've activated your account and you have followed the above instructions, but are still unable to login, contact theService Deskwith the following information:

question: What software is available in the suite of Office software?
answer: The applications included in the desktop version of Office 365 vary depending on your device’s operating system. On a PC computer, the suite includes the latest versions of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, Access, Publisher, & Outlook. On a Mac computer, the latest versions of Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word are included.

question: Can I install the Office 365 apps on my computer instead of using the online version?
answer: Make sure your Concordia email has been activated then follow these instructions forApple MacOSorWindows.

question: What is Microsoft Teams?
answer: Microsoft (MS) Teams is a collaboration app that integrates a number of tools from Microsoft. MS Teams can be used for video meetings, persistent chats, file collaboration, project coordination and video streaming. Faculty and staff can create their own Teams and invite colleagues to join them to collaborate with them.

question: Is there training available for Microsoft Teams?
answer: We encourage students to learn more about using Microsoft Teams through thisquick start guideor by watchingMicrosoft orientation videos.

question: I’m trying to create a new Team but I get a message that it can’t contain a certain word, what should I do?
answer: Certain words in Teams names have been restricted to avoid confusion. If you think you have a legitimate need for one of these restricted words, please contact the IITSService Deskto submit a request.

question: How to I request and activate Concordia Email?
answer: Request an email address on Office 365.

answer: EmPath users can access the application at:https://apex.concordia.ca/emPath70/HrLogin.aspx

question: What are my credentials?
answer: To access EmPath, you must enter your netname and password (same as Carrefour). For more information, visit theNetname account managementpage.

question: How do I download the reports ?
answer: Go to the ‘view reports’ screen, select the appropriate file name and right-click.  A drop-down menu appears with three choices: view, delete, download.  Select ‘download’; you’ll have a choice of Open, Save or Cancel.

question: How do I access my pension or tax statements?
answer: Your pension and tax statements are available through theFaculty and Staff Services page.

question: I received an event invite, how do I RSVP?
answer: If you received an invitation by email there should be a 'call-to-action' link included in the message. Click that link and it will take you directly to the correct registration page.If you can't locate the email, visithttps://engage.concordia.ca/eventsfor a list of all public events.

question: How do I make an online donation?
answer: To make a donation online, visithttps://engage.concordia.ca/donate.

question: Who can I contact for help navigating Engage?
answer: For more information on how to use Engage, contactalumni@concordia.caor call 514-848-2424, ext. 4856.

question: I booked a classroom and want to use the standard equipment in the room. How do I reserve the equipment?
answer: For equipment loan & rental in non-Hospitality Concordia managed venues, submit arequest formto theService Desk.

question: What am I required to provide when I pick up my equipment?
answer: You are required to provide:

question: How is priority determined for loans and rentals?
answer: Priority is given to support academic courses

question: Can I renew my equipment loan?
answer: If equipment is available, rentals may be renewed by contacting theService Desk. Send an email tohelp@concordia.caor submit aweb formand reference the original loan date and equipment.

question: What is the maximum loan time for equipment?
answer: Maximum borrowing time is subject to availability and Service Centre discretion.

question: When do I pick up or return my equipment?
answer: Confirmation of pick up and return time will be communicated upon confirmation of the reservation.

question: How do I modify or cancel my booking?
answer: To modify or cancel a booking, notify theService Deskby email athelp@concordia.caand reference the original date of the booking. To avoid any unnecessary charges, notify theService Desk3 business days in advance.

question: Are there any charges for cancelling my booking?
answer: If direct costs for equipment or labor have been incurred, full charges will apply.

question: I reserved equipment but cannot pick it up at the scheduled time. What do I do?
answer: Equipment reserved for pickup will be held for 90 minutes past the pickup time. Once the 90 minutes have passed, the booking will be automatically cancelled.

question: How do I report lost, damaged, or late equipment?
answer: Notify theService Deskimmediately by email athelp@concordia.caor submit aweb formand reference original date of the rental.

question: How do I request Wi-Fi access for my event?
answer: Requests for Wi-Fi should be submitted at the same time as the original equipment booking.

question: Can equipment be used for musical events ?
answer: Please note that the IITS equipment cannot be used for any musical events that may or may not include  DJs . Musical instruments or external devices cannot be hooked up to any of Concordia's IT equipment

question: Can equipment be taken off-campus?
answer: No, equipment is for on-campus use only

question: Can equipment be used outdoors?
answer: No, our equipment is for indoor use only.

question: Who is a requestor?
answer: The individual authorized to complete the reservation form on behalf of a group (department or association) in order to request space on campus, responsible for ensuring that the event adheres to all university event-related policies and booking terms and conditions.

question: What is the difference between the requestor and the onsite contact?
answer: The requestor has placed the reservation request but the onsite contact is the person who is responsible for being onsite during the entire event (if not the requestor), and assumes responsibility for ensuring that the event adheres to all university event-related policies and booking terms and conditions.

question: What spaces are available to host events on campus?
answer: The MyEvents Browse Venues tab will display Hospitality administered space.

question: How do I know which space is best for my event?
answer: MyEvents will present you with choices according to the criteria your provide (i.e., number of attendees, activity, etc.). If you still have questions, contact Petra Alves, Manager, Conference Services atpetra.alves@concordia.ca.

question: Who can access FRIS?
answer: Access to FRIS is only granted to eligible users at Concordia. Operational access is generally given to department administrators and Dean's Office administrators. Read-only access is given to other eligible University staff.

question: Where do I log into FRIS?
answer: Users may access the FRIS system using a netname and password atfris.concordia.ca.

question: What username and password do I use to access FRIS?
answer: FRIS can be accessed using your Concordia netname and password.

question: What types of access can be granted?
answer: There are different levels of access privileges given to FRIS users.

question: Who grants access to FRIS?
answer: Request for access should be sent to IITSService Desk

question: If I am a first time applicant for part-time postings, how can I obtain a netname to access FRIS?
answer: Part-time faculty applying for the first time are required to fill out theUsername request form.

question: What do I do if I have forgotten my netname?
answer: If you do not remember the netname that was given to you, you may fill out theNetname formthat is found on the FRIS website.

question: How long does it take to get a netname for new applicants (or to retrieve an active netname)?
answer: It takes a maximum of 24 hours to get the information. With the exception of weekends, most requests can be treated within the first 30 minutes.

question: What do I do if I forgot my password?
answer: If you have forgotten your password, you mustvisit password reset page. A 'Forgot' link is also available on the FRIS webpage, which will redirect you back to the netname password reset.

question: What should I do if my fax machine doesn't work?
answer: If the fax machine itself is causing problems, please contact your service provider/vendor. If you suspect that the host line is causing problems contact the Service Desk at x 7613 orhelp@concordiato submit a repair ticket. A Voice Services technician will make a site visit to test and repair the line.

question: How do I dial a long distance fax number?
answer: Most fax lines are programmed with long distance access.

question: Is my data safe?
answer: Your data is stored on a redundant file system and backed up during the day. Data is copied to another location nightly in case of failure of the primary storage system.

question: How can I get a larger personal storage quota?
answer: Faculty and staff are given a quota of 10GB.

question: How can I request permission changes?
answer: Owners of file shares can contact theService Deskto request permission changes.

question: Is my data safe?
answer: Your data is stored on a redundant file system and backed up during the day. Concordia's IT department offers a 12 month window for data recovery on the home drive.

question: Can anyone else access my data?
answer: No, home drive data is only accessible to you, as it requires your netname for authentication.

question: How do I restore a deleted document or folder in the home drive?
answer: To recover a deleted file or folder, follow these steps:

question: How can I optimize the use of available storage space in my home drive?
answer: Faculty and staff are given a quota of 20GB.

question: What is the difference between the Network Folder and Home Drive icons on my desktop?
answer: The two icons serve essentially the same purpose.

question: I don't have a home drive icon on my desktop. What should I do?
answer: If you don't have the icon on your computer and you would like to use the home drive, contact theService Desk.

question: Can I access my home drive from off campus?
answer: If you are using a Concordia-owned device that is not currently connected to the Concordia network, you can use theVirtual Private Networkto access the home drive.

question: Do I lose any intellectual property rights to Concordia when placing recorded classes/videos taken using Concordia’s lecture capture solution on Moodle?
answer: Concordia offers Yuja as a service to Concordians. Subject to the applicable collective agreements and policies, videos belong to the person who recorded them.

question: Do I lose any intellectual property rights if I post videos to non-Concordia webpages?
answer: Normally, each website has its terms of use posted on it (usually in the header or footer of the page). You should review these terms to confirm if you are giving up any of your intellectual property rights before posting your videos.

question: Which classrooms are lecture-capture ready for audio and content?
I'm not an administrator on my computer. Can I still use Yuja?
answer: Yes, Yuja can work as a web-based solution if you are not administrator on your computer. However, if you are not a local administrator and want to install the software client, contact theIT Service Desk.

question: What kind to courses and classes benefit most from this technology?
answer: Recording live lectures is especially useful for large lectures with many students. Furthermore, it is best suited to classes that primarily rely on instructor-led lectures accompanied by slides or documents. Because the microphone is limited to the instructor, highly interactive classes do not lend themselves well to this software because it could miss many of the comments. Similarly, classes that involve much writing on a chalkboard or white board need to be adapted to a document camera for easiest recording.

question: Why are students interested?
answer: The recordings provide students who have difficulty following the original lecture with an opportunity to review the class session. When reviewing the recordings, second-language learners have stated that they can catch points missed in the original lecture.  Other students have commented that the recordings are useful resources when studying for quizzes and exams.

question: How does the recording work?
answer: To record lectures, professors use the Yuja Enterprise Video Platform available on all classroom computers.

question: What is LibCal?
answer: It is a highly customizable and robust platform for booking spaces. LibCal provides an online solution for the online booking of office spaces on campus.

question: What Training is Available for LibCal?
answer: Please review PDF files under the documentation section above.

question: Who Do I Contact for Assistance
answer: For questions and additional assistance, please contact the Service Desk via ourwebformor by phone at 514-848-2424, ext. 7613.

question: How do I add or remove long distance access on my telephone?
answer: This is a feature that is managed by Voice Services. All requests for additional telephone services must be submitted to theService Deskby your departmentalVoIP Coordinator.

question: How do I dial a long distance call?
answer: Within North America: 9 + 1 + area code + 7 digit phone number

question: Can I install the Office 365 apps on my home computer instead of using the online version?
answer: Faculty and staff have access to the online version of the Office 365 apps and have the option of downloading and installing the apps on up to 5 PCs or Mac. Please follow the installation guide forApple MacOSorWindows.

question: Is Visio offered under our agreement with Microsoft?
answer: Our Microsoft 365 Education A3 agreement only includes the Visio Plan 1 license, at no extra cost, as a service. To access,loginusing your Concordia email account and click on Services. The Visio web app will be available there.

Category: Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching
question: What happened to the Microsoft Imagine Standard and Microsoft Imagine Premium subscriptions?
answer: Both programs have been retired and replaced with "Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching". Current subscribers to the Premium program have been transitioned to the Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching and will receive all the additional benefits that come with it.Benefits previously associated with Microsoft Imagine Premium program will still be available under the new Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for teaching subscription.

Category: Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching
question: Where can I find more information about Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching?
answer: You'll find all the information and FAQs you need on theAzure Dev Tools for Teaching FAQweb page.

Category: Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching
question: How can I request Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching software to be installed on my centrally managed computer?
answer: To have Microsoft Azure software installed on your centrally managed computer, contact theService Desk.

Category: Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching
question: How do I access software in the Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching portal?
answer: The easiest way to access the software package is to add a link to your Azure Favorites bar on the left side of the screen.

Category: Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching
question: How can I request Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching software to be installed in a lab?
answer: The request can be made to theService Deskby completing and submitting the web form.Only an active professor teaching a course eligible for the program can submit the request. Requests from students will not be accepted. At the time the ticket is created, the professor must provide the Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching software name, lab location, course name/number and course start/end date before the request can be processed.

Category: Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching
question: What products are included in the Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching subscription?
answer: Visit Microsoft’s website to view acomplete list of products.

Category: Microsoft Azure Dev Tools for Teaching
question: Do I have unlimited usage of the software?
answer: The software must be used for instructional and research purposes. It is not permitted to be used to run the infrastructure of a department. Students may install the software on their personal machines for use with coursework and personal development projects. The software is not to be used to run a business or for ventures that drive commercial profit.

Category: Microsoft Project, Visio, and Visual Studio Licenses
question: I placed a purchase requisition for Microsoft software. How do I get my software?
answer: After the software order is processed by the vendor, a new software deployment ticket will be automatically opened with the IT Service Desk. Employees will be contacted by email in the ticket once the software is ready to be installed.

Category: Microsoft Project, Visio, and Visual Studio Licenses
question: How can I find out if there are licenses available in my department before purchasing additional licenses?
answer: Contact the IT Service Desk viaweb form, specifying the software you wish to use and the department in which you work.

Category: Microsoft Project, Visio, and Visual Studio Licenses
question: An employee left our department, and their license is no longer in use. How can I transfer the license to another university employee?
answer: Contact the IT Service Desk viaweb form, specifying the software you wish to transfer and include the purchase requisition number (if known), computer name and netname of both the employee who used the software last and the new employee who will receive the software.

Category: Microsoft Project, Visio, and Visual Studio Licenses
question: I want to inquire about ordering other Microsoft software. Who do I contact for more information?
answer: Contact the IT Service Desk viaweb form, specifying the software you wish to order.

Category: Microsoft Project, Visio, and Visual Studio Licenses
question: Can I install the software for personal use on my home computer?
answer: No, the software purchased through our reseller is not for personal use. However, Concordia faculty and staff are eligible to obtain theOffice 365software package free of charge and install on personal and university owned devices.

Category: Microsoft Project, Visio, and Visual Studio Licenses
question: I only need a Microsoft 365 license for Visio/Project for one month. Is this possible?
answer: No, we cannot purchase a subscription license for just one month. Our renewal date is June 1stof each year. Purchases are charged at a monthly rate and pro-rated to May 31st. For example, if you request a quote in October, you’ll be quoted for a 7-month subscription.

Category: Microsoft Project, Visio, and Visual Studio Licenses
question: Do I lose access to the Microsoft 365 Project/Visio software if I forget to renew the license subscription before May 31st?
answer: Yes, employees will lose access to the software subscription on May 31stunless it is purchased and renewed for another year. Contact the IT Service Desk viaweb formto request a new quote before the license expiry date on May 31st. It is the employee’s responsibility to request a new quote and ensure the purchase order is placed and processed before the license expires.

Category: Microsoft Project, Visio, and Visual Studio Licenses
question: What is the difference between the Visio licenses?
answer: A Visio Plan 1 license is only available as a web app and does not include the desktop client version. It is included, at no extra cost, in ourMicrosoft365 Education A3 agreement.If employees need the desktop version of Microsoft 365 for Visio, they can purchase aVisio Plan 2 for Educationlicense. Details on how to obtain a quote are listed in the "How to get it?" section of this page. For more information, please visit this Microsoftwebsite.

question: Is my personal mobile device supported?
answer: No. Support is only provided to Concordia-owned mobile devices.

question: Should I contact the Service Desk for help with my mobile device instead of my department's IT support?
answer: Yes, mobile devices are being centrally managed and the Service Desk is better positioned to resolve your issues. Please submit yourrequestto the IITS Service Desk.

question: How will Concordia provide updates and security patches?
answer: In order to ensure your mobile devices meet mandatory security standards, we will be using mobile device management tools such as Intune and Jamf.

question: What does Concordia manage on my mobile device?
answer: Concordia will be able to see information such as your device model, manufacturer, operating system information, installed apps, serial number, owner, and ensure that your device meets organizational security compliance policies.

question: Can I install and remove any apps on my mobile device?
answer: Only apps that are prohibited by the government for security and privacy concerns will be blocked. Currently, TikTok and Wechat have been prohibited.

question: What is Intune?
answer: Intune is a service that focuses on keeping Concordia devices secured and up to date. More specifically, it ensures that your device has installed the latest security patches, OS system updates, and application updates automatically.

question: How can I order or replace a mobile device (phone or tablet)?
answer: Faculty & Researchers:If you are looking to purchase a mobile device without a cellular data subscription, please go to theComputer Purchase processpage to order the device through a purchase requisition.

question: Can I use my personal Apple or Google profile account with my Concordia-owned mobile device?
answer: Yes, you can add your personal Apple or Google account to the device. However, any blocked applications will be blocked even if installed with a personal account. We encourage you to only use Apple or Google accounts associated with your Concordia email address.

question: How often will phones be replaced?
answer: Concordia-owned phones can be replaced every 2 years. The default model is at zero cost. Any additional features or upgrades will be charged to the user’s department.

question: Can I keep my old mobile device?
answer: No, the device is university property and must be recovered before the new phone can be provided. We can assist with transferring data from the old device.

question: What will be the support level offered on my Concordia-owned device?
answer: We will support Concordia mobile applications, Office 365 and connections to the University Wireless Network and VPN.

question: How can I obtain a Concordia-paid phone?
answer: University-paid phones require the approval of your supervisor or department administrator.

question: What kind of internal accounts can be used to pay for the phone?
answer: As phones are typically used by staff members in tasks related to their work, only Operating funds can be charged.

question: I already have a cellular phone and number, can I transfer my number to the University corporate plan?
answer: Yes. Please provide your telephone number, the name of your provider, and the account number to your Supervisor or Department Administrator who will coordinate the transfer with IITS. Once transferred please note that the telephone number becomes the property of the university.

question: I will be travelling outside of Canada, will my phone work?
answer: All corporate phones are limited to work ONLY in Canada. If travelling outside of Canada, please have your supervisor or department's phone administrator complete theInternational Roaming Formand submit it through IITS at least 5 business days before your departure.

question: I already have a Concordia-paid mobile device, but would like to transfer the number to my personal device, is this possible?
answer: In most cases, the phone number can be transferred to your personal device. However there are situations which might require the university to retain the number and transfer it to someone else. Such requests will be examined on a case-by-case basis.

question: I no longer wish to use a Concordia-owned device, how can I opt out?
answer: Please discuss the situation with your manager who can then see about cancelling the phone or re-assigning it to another person.

question: Can I access Moodle directly without going through the Hub?
answer: You can access Moodle directly from theMoodle homepageusing your Concordia email.Your list of courses will appear in the Course overview block on your Moodle Dashboard.

question: I am a registered student trying to access Moodle but it is not working. What can I do?
answer: In order for the course to be accessible to students on Moodle, instructors must "activate" it.  If you are unable to find the course, contact your instructor to ensure they have made the course visible to students.

question: Why am I unable to access my course website even though my professor says it is available?
answer: You will have access to all 'activated' Moodle courses 24 hours after registration. Otherwise, make sure that the instructor is using Moodle and has not forgotten to make the course site visible to students.

question: How do I update my profile on Moodle?
answer: Moodle is connected to the Student Information System (SIS). Changes to your name and email address should be done byupdating your personal informationin your Student Centre. Once you have made changes in the SIS, it will take up to 48 hours for your Moodle profile to automatically update.

question: Why am I not getting forum emails and other students are?
answer: It is likely that the email address in your profile is wrong. Verify theprofile update FAQsection to update your email. It could also be that you are not subscribed to the forums that are generating emails or that you have not enabled your messaging preferences to receive email notifications.

question: What browsers are recommended for the best experience in Moodle 4.1?
answer: Moodle works well on all standards-compliant browsers.

question: Who do I contact for help with Moodle?
answer: Students should contact theService Deskfor help with Moodle.

question: How do I make the course available to students?
answer: For instructions on how to make your course available to students, refer to the “Make your course visible in Moodle” guide in the “Modifying course settings and format” module. This and other resources are available on theHelp for Instructorspage. Please note you will need to sign into Moodle to view the page.

question: How do I enrol individual users in Moodle?
answer: Students are automatically enrolled into your courses. It is not recommended to manually add students to your course.

question: How do I view the list of participants on my Moodle site?
answer: Toview the listof participants:

question: How do I communicate with students in Moodle?
answer: For instructions on how to communicate with students in Moodle, refer to the  “Communicating with students” module. This and other resources are available on theHelp for Instructorspage. Please note you will need to sign  into Moodle to view the page.

question: What browsers are recommended for the best experience in Moodle 4.1?
answer: Moodle works well on all standards-compliant browsers.

question: How do I get help with Moodle?
answer: Moodle questions should be directed to theIT Service Desk.

question: What is the Course Reserves Moodle block?
answer: Instructors should not post copyrighted materials on their Moodle course site.

question: I’ve forgotten my password and/or netname. What should I do?
answer: To reset your password and/or retrieve your netname:

question: How do I reset my password ?
answer: 1.     Visit theForgot Passwordpage and select your account type.

question: My account is locked. What is that and how can I fix it?
answer: Account lockout is a password security feature that disables a user account when a certain number of failed logons occur due to wrong passwords within a certain interval of time.

question: Why is the portal not accepting my personal information?
answer: If you are trying to activate your netname or reset your password, and the system is not accepting your information, you will have to verify your personal information with the appropriate department.

question: Why has my account been disabled?
answer: Netname accounts that are created but never used or are inactive for an extended period of time will be disabled for security purposes. If you still have access to the email address and basic personal information on file with Concordia, you can use the enabling feature (available on the portal when the 'Your account has been disabled' error is shown) to access your account.

question: I am an employee and am unable to access the Carrefour portal. What should I do?
answer: If you no longer know your netname and/or password:

question: I don't know my ID number (required for certain netname services). How can I retrieve it?
answer: Your student or employee ID can be found on your ID card, your admissions e-mail, or any official documents you may have received from Concordia. Students can also find their ID number by accessing theStudent Information System (SIS)and clicking on “Demographic Information” at the bottom of the page.

question: Can I change my netname?
answer: Netnames are computer generated based on your legal name upon acceptance to Concordia as staff, faculty, or student, or upon submission of an application for admission. As they are used for many of Concordia's systems, netnames can only be changed in the event of a legal name change.

question: What is a sponsored netname account?
answer: Sponsored netnames are granted to users who are not paid employees of the University, but will be on campus for an extended period of time. These accounts must be requested by an active Concordia faculty or staff member.

question: What is a function netname account?
answer: Function netnames do not reflect the name of a specific user, but instead are created for a specific role or position at Concordia.These accounts must be requested and owned by an active Concordia faculty or staff member, but the ownership may be transferable depending on the account's function.

question: How do I request a static IP address?
answer: If you are requesting a new wired network connection, the IP address information will automatically be provided by IITS.

question: I can no longer use my static IP address to remotely connect to my workstation. How can I connect?
answer: You can remotely connect to your workstation by using your workstation’s hostname. This information can be retrieved from your workstation by opening a web browser and typing in the URL field “myip.concordia.ca” (without the quotes). Your hostname is in the “Host and Domain Name” section.

question: Is Office 365 secure?
answer: When evaluating cloud service platforms for potential use by the Concordia community, IITS performs Privacy Impact Assessments (PIA).Click here to learn more about Concordia’s PIA process and privacy controls.While Office 365 has many security features additional precautions are always recommended when storing data as detailed in some of the points below.

question: How should I work securely with documents in the O365 apps?
answer: As with any cloud service, there are important considerations to keep in mind when using Office 365 apps for document storage. The information below also applies to any other tool that you may use collaboratively for your work at Concordia.

question: How do I get help with Office 365?
answer: If you’re new to the Office 365 environment,click here to jointhe new to Teams/Office 365 Ask Us Team. The team is comprised of keen Concordia employees actively working together to share knowledge and problem solve with Office 365!

question: What programs are available in the Office 365 apps?
answer: All faculty and staff have access to the same set of Office 365 apps which includes online versions of the office suite and a set of additional apps used for collaborating and file sharing. To get a complete and up to date list of the apps available, please log into theMicrosoft online portal.

question: Are there mobile apps available?
answer: Microsoft offers a number of mobile versions of their Office 365 apps without additional cost or licensing.  For a complete list of mobile apps, we encourage faculty and staff to visit Microsoft Corporation’sGoogle Play StoreorApple Storepages according to their device manufacturer.

question: Can I install the Office 365 apps locally on my office computer?
answer: No. If your office computer is owned by Concordia, contact theService Deskor yourIT Repto have Microsoft Office installed with their assistance as there may be some compatibility issues with previous versions of the Office suite.

question: Can I install the Office 365 apps on my home computer instead of using the online version?
answer: Faculty and staff have access to the online version of the Office 365 apps and have the option of downloading and installing the apps on up to 5 PCs or Mac. Please follow the installation guide forApple MacOSorWindows.

question: How long will I have access to the Office 365 apps?
answer: You will have access to Office 365 as long as you are an active Concordia employee.

question: What is Microsoft Teams?
answer: Microsoft (MS) Teams is a collaboration app that integrates a number of tools from Microsoft.  MS Teams can be used for video meetings, workplace chats, file collaboration, project coordination and video streaming. Faculty and staff can create their own Teams and invite colleagues to join them to collaborate with them.

question: Is there training available for Microsoft Teams?
answer: We encourage faculty and staff to learn more about using Microsoft Teams through thisquick start guideor by watchingMicrosoft orientation videos.

question: I’m trying to create a new Team but I get a message that it can’t contain a certain word, what should I do?
answer: Certain words in Teams names have been restricted to avoid confusion.  If you think you have a legitimate need for one of these restricted words, please contact the IITS Service Desk to submit a request.

question: I accidently deleted a file in Office 365. How do I retrieve the file?
answer: Check your recycle bin and second stage recycle bin in your OneDrive online portal.

question: I am not able to view comments in a shared document. What should I do?
answer: Make sure all users editing the document are using the same version of Office. There may be minor problems between users collaborating and using different versions of desktop Office suites (such as Office 2016 and Office 365 ProPlus). Some features may not exist in an older version of Office or may be implemented in a new way. If the same desktop version cannot be used and problems occur, we recommend using Office Online (web version) available in Office 365.

question: Do I need to activate my Concordia Email ?
answer: No. Email addresses for new staff are now being automatically provisioned within 4 hours.

question: What is MyAnalytics?
answer: MyAnalytics presents you with insights and how you can use these insights to improve your work patterns. To access the dashboard, go to myanalytics.microsoft.com to open your personal MyAnalytics.We encourage faculty and staff to learn more about using MyAnalytics through thisFAQ guideor by watchingthis Microsoft videoshowing common benefits of using MyAnalytics.

question: How can I sign up for an Office 365 email account?
answer: Activate your Office 365 email account.Your account will be accessible in 2 business days.

question: When can I activate my email account?
answer: You will be able to activate your email account two weeks prior to the beginning of the semester.

answer: To install Office 365 Education, your device must meet theminimum system requirements.

answer: If you have already activated the @live.concordia.ca email account, you may choose to activate the new @mail.concordia.ca email alias.

answer: On the main login page, you will need to enter 'your_netname@live.concordia.ca' to access the Concordia-specific login page.

question: When is it appropriate to use the online payment requisition form?
answer: The online payment requisition form is used to issue payments to external organizations who cannot invoice the University directly.

question: What is the process for submitting an online payment requisition form?
answer: Users fill out the required information and a PDF file with the information is generated with a unique payment request number. Once this is generated, the user can print out the PDF, have it approved, and submit the form to Financial Services for payment.

question: OpenData documentation

Category: Plotting - Gina Cody School of Engineering and Computer Science
question: What is my plotting quota?
answer: The first time a Gina Cody School student sends a job to a plotter, a plotting quota of 25 pages is allocated to that user. A printing quota of 50 pages is given for the ledger size prints. These quotas are non-renewable. If you need extra quota, your supervisor must submit a request to theService Deskon your behalf.

Category: Plotting - Gina Cody School of Engineering and Computer Science
question: What is the allowed size for plotted printouts?
answer: DuringCapstone Presentation Week, the narrower side of the plotted printout must not exceed 36 inches. Please ensure your poster design fits within this restriction.

Category: Plotting - Gina Cody School of Engineering and Computer Science
question: What file types should I have with me at my plotting appointment?
answer: Through the years, students have been encouraged to send print jobs to plotters in PDF format. However, for certain posters, it may be necessary to send the print job from the original application. Therefore, when you present yourself to H-964, make sure you have access to your file(s) in both the original and the PDF format.

Category: Plotting - Gina Cody School of Engineering and Computer Science
question: How do I create a PDF file from my original file type?
answer: CutePDF Writeris installed on all Gina Cody School lab machines. It shows up as a printer when you use an application's print function.

question: Can I use Power BI if I’m part time faculty or staff?
answer: Yes, you can download and install power BI desktop on your computer. For license availability contact the service desk for details on what license is available to you.

question: How does the Power BI service work?
answer: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/fundamentals/power-bi-service-overview

question: What is a Data Steward?
answer: A data Steward is an oversight or data governance role within Concordia University. Data Stewards have sector- specific responsibility for facilitating appropriate data and information systems use of their respective systems, and for ensuring compliance with applicable policies, procedures and standards.

question: How can I share my reports and dashboards with others if I don’t have a Pro license?
answer: You can share PBIX files directly with others. They can open them in their personal workspace or using Power BI Desktop. Please note that you are responsible for any content being shared and must ensure that any data governance requirements are met.

question: Who can print to a colour printer?
answer: Only faculty and staff can print to ENCS colour printers. Students who need a colour printout must give the document to their professor to print or use theConcordia DPrint service.

Category: Printing - Gina Cody School of Engineering and Computer Science
question: How do I print multiple lecture slides on one page?
answer: You’ll commonly want to print two or more lecture slides on each paper. It is quite easy in Adobe and Power Point’s print dialog box. You can also use this feature in combination with double sided printing.

question: How do I print double-sided?
answer: Printing double-sided (duplex) allows you to print on both sides of the page. This type of printing differs based on the operating system and printer you use.

answer: Log in to theStudent Hubwith your netname and go to My CU Account > Personal information & accounts >Activate Office 365 email. Click the available button to activate your Microsoft 365 email account. Your account will be accessible in two (2) business days.
