Category: Qualtrics - John Molson School of Business
question: Which web browsers are supported by Qualtrics?
answer: It is recommended that researchers use the latest version of either Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Apple Safari, or Internet Explorer with JavaScript enabled to ensure maximum compatibility with the system. Browsers older than Firefox 4, Chrome 2, Safari 3, or IE 8 are not supported.

Category: Qualtrics - John Molson School of Business
question: Will the institutional Qualtrics pilot impact the JMSB Qualtrics license?
answer: No, the institutional Qualtrics pilot license will have no impact on the JMSB Qualtrics license, and no action is required from JMSB Qualtrics users.

question: Why do I have to ensure that the SYNC function is on when I am using QuickAccess?
answer: The SYNC function turns off when you click on one of the resources to ensure that your content does not disappear if you switch it to another application while reading it. You will then need to manually click on the SYNC toggle so that QuickAccess recognizes the application that you are navigating in and provides relevant resources for you.

question: I don’t see any resources available for the application I am in. Why is that?
answer: Concordia’s IITS team is gradually making resources available to support Concordians within certain applications. If no resources are currently available for the application you are in, you will see a sad orange indicating that there is no content.

question: After placing my equipment, will I still have physical access to the machines?
answer: In the event of hardware failure or other exceptional circumstances requiring physical access to the device, you may be accompanied to the data centre by IT Research Support staff. Remote management of devices through SSH, remote KVM, or web interface will be available to you.

question: How are your servers kept secure?
answer: The machine rooms on both the SGW & Loyola campuses are temperature regulated, require a keycard to gain access, and are equipped with security cameras.

question: Who will maintain the equipment hosted in the data centre?
answer: We will work together to establish support structures through a Service Level Agreement. For example, If your group already has the IT expertise, we will work collaboratively with you.

question: Will end users be notified of the maintenance windows?
answer: Yes, when establishing the Service Level Agreement, a "Responsible Person" is designated and they will be the primary point of contact regarding planned maintenance.

question: How much storage space can be allocated to me?
answer: As a base level service, individual researchers may be allocated up to 100GB and recognized research groups allocated up to 1TB of storage at no cost. Additional storage is possible & allocations are determined in collaboration with the IT Research Support team.

question: How will my research data be kept safe?
answer: Our file servers are located in a secured room where data is backed up on a nightly basis & copies are automatically stored on both SGW and Loyola campuses.

question: My research data is highly confidential. Who will have access to it on your system?
answer: By default, only you will have rights to what is stored. However, sharing your data internally is certainly possible. For a needs assessment or consultation,contact us.

question: Will the end users be notified of the maintenance windows?
answer: Yes, when drafting the Service Level Agreement, a "Responsible Person" is designated and they will be the primary point of contact regarding planned maintenance.

question: Can I choose the operating system of my virtualized server?
answer: Yes, you can choose between common Linux distributions and a supported version of Windows Server.

question: How are your servers kept secure?
answer: The machine rooms on both the SGW & Loyola campuses are temperature regulated, require a keycard to gain access, and are equipped with security cameras.

question: What are the technical specifications of the virtual server?
answer: Our base level servers consist of: 2 Virtual CPUs, 100GB of Storage, and 4GB of RAM. Should you require additional performance, contact theIT Research Support team.

question: Who will maintain the virtual server?
answer: We will work together to establish support structures through a Service Level Agreement. For example, If your group already has the IT expertise, we will work collaboratively with you.

question: Will the end users be notified of the maintenance windows?
answer: Yes, when establishing the Service Level Agreement, a "Responsible Person" is designated and they will be the primary point of contact regarding planned maintenance.

question: Your configuration does not suit my needs. Can it be customized?
answer: Yes, though fees may apply. For a needs assessment,contact us.

question: How can I protect my personal Computer ?
answer: SentinelOne is not offered for personal computers but there are paid and free products out there to protect Windows and MacOS machines like BitDefender, Kaspersky or Sophos.

question: How do I know I am protected with SentinelOne ?
answer: Once your computer is enrolled into SentinelOne, you will see this icon in the task bar.

question: On which Operating Systems does it run ?
answer: Windows 10, MAC OS and some distribution of Linux.

question: Do I need to uninstall my old antivirus program ?
answer: An uninstallation of Sophos will be occur eventually as part of the migration process.

question: Will SentinelOne protect me against ransomware ?
answer: Yes, SentinelOne will recognize the behaviors of ransomware and prevent it from encrypting files.

question: Will SentinelOne slow down my system ?
answer: The SentinelOne client uses a small amount of system resources and should not impact your daily activities.

question: Does SentinelOne protect me while I am disconnected from the internet (such as during traveling) ?
answer: Yes, you will be protected against malware threats when the device is disconnected from the internet.

question: Can I configure all of the settings within my instance ?
answer: The client does not require any special configuration.

question: How can I protect my personal computer ?
answer: The University’s SentinelOne subscription is not offered for personal computers. There are many security products on the market to protect personal devices on Windows and MacOS machines such as BitDefender, Kaspersky, or Sophos.

question: What are the system requirements for Cisco Jabber?
answer: View all system and hardware requirements.

question: Do I need a VPN connection to be able to use Jabber outside the office?
answer: Yes, it is mandatory to be connected to thevirtual private network (VPN)to use Jabber from off campus. If your VPN connection drops, Jabber will lose connectivity. Please always make sure your VPN is connected before starting Jabber.

question: When I use Jabber to place phone calls, should I use a headset?
answer: Yes, in order to experience the best sound quality and minimize interference, we recommend you use a headset.

question: Does Jabber have multi-line functionality?
answer: No. The current version of our call manager system supports only one line for Jabber.

question: Can I forward a voicemail message using the Cisco Jabber client?
answer: Yes.

question: What is presence status?
answer: Presence status information lets you know if your contacts are available for chat, on the phone, in a meeting or away from their desk.

question: How do I change my status?
answer: Click the drop-down menu next to your own status message at the top of the Cisco Jabber window or open the global Cisco Jabber menu.

question: I do not want to be disturbed during a meeting, what should I do?
answer: If you do not want to be disturbed by incoming calls or instant messaging sound alerts during a meeting, selectDo Not Disturbin the status drop-down list. This will mute your softphone ringing.​

question: Can I put a call on hold on my desk phone and then resume the call from a Jabber client, or vice versa?
answer: Yes. Press ‘HOLD’ on one device, and press ‘RESUME’ on the other device to resume the call.

question: Are chat conversations saved?
answer: Beginning with Cisco Jabber for Windows 9.2.1, chat history will be saved for the duration of the login session for Orgs that have the chat history feature disabled. Once the user signs out of their account, no chat history from the previous login session is displayed.

question: Jabber is not functioning correctly. What should I do?
answer: The first step to correct malfunctions is to close the application and then open it again.

question: What should I do if I installed Cisco Jabber on a personal device (e.g., laptop) and then lost the device?
answer: Please contact the IITS Service Desk at extension 7613 so that the device's instance of the Cisco Jabber client can be disabled.

question: Where can I get user guides or instructions for Jabber?
answer: Please contact theIITS Service Deskto create a ticket.

question: Can I use Jabber on my Smartphone devices, tablet or iPad?

question: My personal information is not accepted when I try to reset my password. What should I do?
answer: Students should contact the Service Desk by phone at 514-848-2424, ext. 7613 or by email athelp@concordia.ca.

question: Can I change my netname?
answer: Netnames are computer generated based on your legal name upon acceptance to Concordia as staff, faculty, or student, or upon submission of an application for admission. Netnames can only be changed in the event of a legal name change.

question: How can I change my e-mail address in the Student Hub?
answer: To ensure you receive important information from Concordia, please enter your e-mail address in the Student Hub. Correspondence from Professors (and Moodle), Administrators and other Concordia departments will be sent to this e-mail address.

question: How can I change my home address, phone number, and emergency contact information in the Student Hub?

question: How does the new Student Hub differ from the student hub that exists on the web already?

question: How do I access the services that are currently on MyConcordia?
answer: All the services that are currently on the MyConcordia portal are available to you on the Student Hub via the “My CU Account” page. This page is easily accessed from the Student Hub landing page, navigation bar, and through the sign-in menu drop down found at the top right-hand side of every concordia.ca page.

answer: Voice services must program this for you. Please contact theService Deskto request this programming modification.Please note: The Service Desk will only accept requests fromVOIP coordinatorsfor phone orders.

question: Why can't I continue with payment after selecting my payment method?
answer: To complete the tuition payment, pop-ups must be allowed in your browser. The final screen will open in a new window, allowing you to process the payment in a trusted third party payment system.

question: Where can I find help with using Udemy for Business?
answer: Concordia Library is your point of contact for making the most out of using Udemy content, contact them directly atAsk a LibrarianFor technical assistance, contact theIITS helpdesk.

question: As a faculty member, can I use Udemy content as part of my course?
answer: Yes, taking into account that users must consent to the service’s privacy policy.  As such, Udemy courses can’t be mandatory. So, plan alternatives for students who do not wish to provide their consent.

question: As a manager, can I use Udemy content as part of training and development for my employees?
answer: Yes, taking into account that employees must consent to the service’s privacy policy. In such cases, alternatives to Udemy should be suggested for those who do not wish to provide their consent.

question: Can I use Udemy on my mobile device
answer: There is a Udemy for Business app available for bothAndroidandiOSdevices.Before being able to log into the service using your mobile device app, you must have logged in at least once through the Udemy website to create your Udemy account.

question: I can’t find a course from Udemy in the Concordia catalogue
answer: Concordia has a subscription to the Udemy for Business service which provides access to over four thousand of the highest rated and most popular Udemy courses, however not all courses available on Udemy are included in our license.

question: I found a Udemy course that is not offered in Udemy for Business, can it be added to our catalogue?
answer: There is a process for suggesting a course be added to the Udemy for Business collection directly through Udemy. Please visit theUdemy for Business FAQ articleon the subject to find out more.

question: Do Udemy courses count for credit?
answer: No, Udemy is an optional service. Courses taken within Udemy do not carry university credit.

question: How does Udemy for business handle data privacy?
answer: Concordia has performed aPrivacy Impact Assessment(PIA) of the Udemy service.

question: Do I need to hire technical support staff for my event if I know how to operate the equipment myself?
answer: In certain cases, clients maybe able to operate equipment themselves (please contact your booking agent for confirmation). IITS Event staff will setup and take down equipment for your event. Labour charges for virtual and on-site support technicians my apply.

question: How much notice do I need to modify my request for Virtual or On-Site technical support?
answer: Changes to requests can be made up tothree business daysin advance forweekdayevents, and up tofive business daysin advance forweekendevents, by communicating with your booking agent.

question: What is the minimum duration I can request a technician?
answer: A minimum ofthree hoursis charged.

question: Will I automatically have technical support for the duration of my event?
answer: No. Technician service for the duration of an event is charged separately and must be requested when the equipment is booked.A minimum of three hours is charged.

question: How do I know if I need to make a Virtual or On-site technical support request or an equipment request?

question: What Zoom Webinar support services are available through IITS?
What is your Hybrid event support offering?

We can consult with you on best practices, tools and guide you to our colleagues at Hospitality for event design assistance.

question: What is a virtual meeting?
answer: A virtual meeting is not a physical location - it is a communications solution that allows participants from multiple locations to connect video systems, desktop computers, tablets, and mobile devices in real time for the purpose of holding meetings, presentations, and collaboration sessions.

question: Hosting a meeting versus hosting a webinar
answer: Zoom meetings are ideal for hosting more interactive sessions where you'll want to have lots of audience participation or break your session into smaller groups.  Whereas, webinars may be considered like a virtual hall or auditorium.  Webinars are ideal for large audiences or events that are open to the public.  Typically webinar attendees do not interact with one another.  Though Zoom provides options for you to get more social with your attendees, your average webinar has one or a few people speaking to an audience.

question: How do I know if I’m connected to my Concordia Zoom account?
answer: Learn how to connect to Concordia software client[PDF 394 KB]

question: What webinar services are available through IITS?
answer: Concordia’s Zoom webinar service is centrally managed by IITS and is available to all Faculty and Staff. The service, which can host between 300 to 500 participants, allows large scale events to be hosted in a virtual environment, connecting participants from different locations to see and hear live presentations and ask questions through a chat-based interface.

question: Is Zoom secure?
answer: Yes, the web conference service provides multi-layer protection which includes secure data centers, infrastructure, media handling & encryption, and application-level security. Please refer to thebest practices for securing Zoom meetings[212 KB] document for more information on how to use Zoom securely.

question: What are the minimum requirements to use Zoom?
answer: Bandwidth requirements

question: How do I access my web conference account?
answer: You can access your basic account by signing into theConcordia web conferencing portalusing your Concordia netname and password. The account allows for an unlimited number of web conferencing sessions for an unlimited time with up to 300 participants.

question: How do I host or join a meeting?
answer: Mobile users can download the mobile application directly to their device by visiting the app store (iTunes, Google Play Store, etc.) and searching for the 'Zoom' application.

question: I am unable to hear my participants. What do I do?
answer: By default, all meeting participants are muted when they initially join a meeting.The meeting host has the ability to mute/unmute participants manually or change meeting settings to allow participants to unmute themselves.

question: What is a meeting host?
answer: The meeting host is often referred to as the “chair”. The meeting host has overall control, including the ability to mute/unmute other participants and disconnect other users.

question: I am a TA. Everytime I access Zoom through Moodle, I get error message 2216. What should I do?
answer: Log into Moodle with your employee netname (e.g. @concordia.ca or @staff.concordica.ca). After selecting the Zoom link on your Moodle page, the new window displays a 2216 error message:

question: As a TA, what steps do I need to take to get my enhanced Zoom license?
answer: As a teaching assistant (TA), you are required to activate your own enhanced Zoom license so you can create meetings in Moodle and host meetings for longer than 40 minutes. After you have activated your enhanced Zoom license, you must ensure your employee netname and email address match the information in your Moodle profile.

question: Why do I need an account administrator to authorize any add-ons or apps within Zoom?
answer: In an effort to be able to support end users and to make sure that legal and privacy concerns are respected, an application subcommittee was created in order to assess the requests of Concordia end users in regards of the usability of third-party software that interact with our authorized and supported technology toolbox.

question: How long will my document stay in the print queue?
answer: Once your document has been sent from the Web Print system, it will be accessible in the print queue for 24 hours.

question: What credentials do I use to access Web Print?

question: What is the URL for Web Print?
